title: Should you perform meditation on an empty stomach? | The Times of India

cleaned_text: an empty stomach? Pranayama is the main component of yoga. Originated from two Sanskrit words- Prana and Yama- the word means to gain control over life energy. Pranayama is a system of controlled breathing. It involves breathing exercises and patterns where you purposely have to inhale, exhale, and hold your breath in a sequenced manner. When combined with yoga asana and meditation, pranayama can help to elevate several ailments and relax your mind. But just like other yoga asana and workouts, there are rules of performing pranayama to reap maximum benefits. The most common of all is that it should be performed only on an empty stomach. [readmore](javascript://) 02/4Why should you perform it on an empty stomach? Pranayama produces a lot of energy, and it is important to concentrate this energy towards your breathing or yoga asana to reap maximum benefits. When you perform any exercise on a full stomach, it may be hard for you to stay focused and still for a while. Besides, all the energy produced during pranayama will be consumed to digest the food, instead of calming your mind and healing your body. [readmore](javascript://) 03/4The ideal time The ideal time to perform pranayama is in the morning on an empty stomach. Do not load on food when performing the exercise as it will reduce the effectiveness of your workout. You are not required to do it early in the morning always. Just your stomach should be empty and clear of waste products. If you choose to do it during the daytime, take a break of at least 3 to 4 hours after a meal. In case of tea and fruits, wait for 45 minutes and 15 minutes after drinking water. [readmore](javascript://) 04/4Other important rules of performing pranayama Pranayama is beneficial for calming your mind and enhancing concentration. If you are dedicating time to perform this important form of workout then here are some guidelines that you must follow. Sit in a clean and peaceful place Keep your mind calm, composed and sit in the correct posture. Practice a specific number of repetitions. Experiment with different kinds of pranayama to see which one works the best for you. Pranayama is not only about breathing in and out. Try to control your breathing while performing it. You can also opt for chanting the mantra 'Om'. This makes it easier to concentrate. Do not perform pranayama in a haste. Stay calm and take your time.
